Orchestra.tip: Center orchestra rows F-M offer the best views. Avoid partial view seats in far sides.

Mezzanine.tip: Front mezzanine (rows A-C) often better than rear orchestra. Great for full stage view.

Orchestra.tip: Largest Broadway theater. Sit center for Wicked's dragon effect.

Mezzanine.tip: Higher mezzanine is quite far but still good views.

shows.name: Hamilton
shows.fun_fact: The show's lottery offers $10 tickets, but odds are about 1 in 300.
shows.newbie_tip: Don't stress about perfect seats - the staging works well from anywhere. The music carries the show.

shows.name: Wicked
shows.fun_fact: Running since 2003, it's Broadway's 4th longest-running show.
shows.newbie_tip: Arrive early to take photos at the giant mechanical dragon in the lobby!

first_timer_tips: Orchestra doesn't always mean better - front mezzanine often has superior views
Service fees can add 20-30% to the advertised price
Wednesday matinees have an older, quieter audience
Rush tickets are same-day discounted tickets, usually requiring morning wait
common_mistakes: Buying from street sellers (often fake tickets)
Not checking the theater location (some are far from subway)
Assuming partial view means slightly obstructed (it can mean seeing only half the stage)
Waiting too long for popular shows (prices only go up)
